name: AFRICA ADVOCACY FOUNDATION
goal:
Africa Advocacy Foundation is a registered charity established in 1996 that promotes better health, education and other life opportunities for disadvantaged people through practical support, advocacy, campaigns,
information, advice, guidance and training.

AAF was set up to address poor health outcomes and social issues and particularly to tackle increasing HIV/AIDS prevalence levels among migrant communities at a time of very low awareness levels, limited HIV treatment opportunities and widespread HIV stigma and discrimination.

Over the past 22 years, AAF has supported and empowered some of the most marginalized individuals experiencing complex and multiple disadvantages and barriers. The organisation has a great track record of working with individuals at risk and those diagnosed with HIV many of who are experiencing stigma, discrimination, ageism, poor health outcomes and lack of awareness of healthcare access.

Our activities include;
• HIV, viral hepatitis and TB awareness and prevention as well as the promotion of testing and treatment services
• HIV peer support services through drop-ins, one-one support, community
outreach, and awareness events
• Advocacy and campaigns and the promotion of sexual and reproductive health rights for disadvantaged individuals and groups especially migrants.
• Community based HIV testing and supporting linkage to care.
• Training of community advocates, volunteers and frontline professionals.
• Community research.
interests: Communication, Culture, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Research and innovation, Youth
